meanings.definition: A town hall or municipal council in Spanish-speaking countries.
meanings.sent1: The cabildo met to discuss important town matters.
meanings.sent2: The mayor gave a speech at the cabildo meeting.
meanings.sent3: The cabildo members had a lively debate about the new park design.
meanings.sent4: The cabildo stood tall in the center of the bustling town square.
meanings.sent5: The colorful flags fluttered in front of the cabildo, drawing everyone's attention.

meanings.definition: A building housing a town hall or municipal council.
meanings.sent1: The cabildo building was a historic landmark in the city.
meanings.sent2: Citizens gathered outside the cabildo for a protest.
meanings.sent3: The cabildo's roof leaked during the heavy rainstorm.
meanings.sent4: The cabildo's architecture reflected the town's rich history.
meanings.sent5: Tourists admired the intricate details of the cabildo's facade.

meanings.definition: A group of people forming a governing body in a Spanish-speaking country.
meanings.sent1: The cabildo members worked together to pass new laws.
meanings.sent2: The cabildo's decisions affected the entire community.
meanings.sent3: The cabildo's annual picnic was a fun way to bond outside of meetings.
meanings.sent4: The cabildo's unity was crucial during times of crisis.
meanings.sent5: The cabildo's diversity of opinions led to productive discussions.
